title: LME aluminium cash offer price drops 3.88% to $2,996/t; opening stock slips 0.41%
summary: LME aluminium prices recorded a sharp decline on February 13, with cash bid prices falling to $2,995/t from $3,116.5/t (3.90% decline). The price drop is attributed to stock market declines, profit-taking, position squaring, strong US labour data, and reduced China demand before Lunar New Year.

title: White House denies reports of steel, aluminum tariff rollback
summary: The White House pushed back against recent reports suggesting a potential rollback of the 50% steel and aluminum tariffs. White House trade advisor Peter Navarro stated there was no basis for reports that the administration planned to reduce these tariffs.

title: Aluminium prices drop to one-week low on report Trump may ease tariffs
summary: Benchmark three-month aluminium on the London Metal Exchange fell 1.9% to $3,040.50/t after reports that the US may trim some tariffs. The decline reflects macro-driven risk-off sentiment, profit-taking, and reduced physical demand ahead of the Chinese Lunar New Year break.

title: Aluminum pulls back after a one-week low following market digests reporting Trump may ease tariffs
summary: Aluminum prices fell to their lowest level in a week on Friday after reports that the U.S. may slash some import tariffs. The benchmark three-month aluminum on the LME lost as much as 2.7% but reduced losses to 0.9% by end of trading at $3,074/t.

title: Trump plans to ease some steel, aluminum tariffs
summary: Donald Trump plans to scale back select steel and aluminum tariffs amid price concerns. The announcement caused shares of major producers like Alcoa and Century Aluminum to decline significantly, while benchmark aluminum prices on the LME fell to one-week lows.

title: How Supply Cracks and China's Recovery Are Fueling a 2026 Bull Run
summary: Aluminum prices surged 5.7% in early February 2026 due to China's industrial rebound from stimulus policies boosting demand for appliances using aluminum. Global supply chains are tightening, benefiting producers like Alcoa, which forecasts 2026 output up to 2.6 million tons. Higher costs from U.S. Midwest Premium and tariffs pressure mid-market manufacturers in automotive and aerospace.

title: Aluminum pulls back after a one-week low following market digests reporting Trump may ease tariffs
summary: Aluminum prices fell to a one-week low on Friday, dropping as much as 2.7% to $3,074 per metric ton on the LME after reports of potential U.S. tariff reductions. The metal had peaked due to supply concerns but pulled back amid tariff speculation. Alcoa and Century Aluminum shares declined alongside steelmakers.

title: White House denies reports of steel, aluminum tariff rollback
summary: The White House denied reports suggesting a potential rollback of the 50% steel and aluminum tariffs. This statement addresses market speculation impacting commodity prices and related stocks.

title: Aluminum at the Centre of Global Industrial Transformation AICE 2026
summary: The aluminum industry is undergoing significant transformation driven by regulatory pressure and sustainability commitments. AICE 2026 highlights how recycling has become a strategic priority alongside primary production, with investment accelerating in scrap collection, sorting, and remelting technologies. The industry is also focusing on productivity improvements through digitalization, automation, and smarter energy management.

title: Aluminum Cans Recycling Services Market Projected to Reach
summary: Rising primary aluminum costs are making recycled aluminum economically attractive, as recycling consumes 95% less energy than primary production. Technological advancements including AI-powered sorting systems and advanced metallurgical analysis are expanding market opportunities, with Asia-Pacific capturing 35% of incremental growth and mandatory recycling targets driving $4.8 billion in infrastructure investment.

title: Brazil to Host Latin America's First Exclusive Metal Packaging Congress
summary: Brazil is hosting Latin America's first exclusive metal packaging congress. Limited details are available from the press release provided.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,056 CNY/T on February 13, 2026, up 0.53% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 2.80%, and are down 4.68% year-over-year. The data was last updated on February 16, 2026.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 965.04 USD/T on February 16, 2026, down 0.72% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 2.89%, with a yearly increase of 26.56%. The data was last updated on February 15, 2026.

title: February 16, 2026 Scrap & Used Car Market Update
summary: Ferrous scrap shows modest improvement, with shredded steel trading in the $290-$315 per ton range. Mills are returning from the holiday with restocked order books. This indicates positive trends in the scrap steel market.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 16.02.2026
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures rebar terms as of February 13, 2026. Various futures contracts for regions like China, Turkey, Europe, and North America are listed. The platform offers analyses and comments on the industry.

title: Wheel steel prices: China's major cities (Feb 13, 2026 16:18)
summary: Mysteel reports wheel steel prices across China's major cities as of February 13, 2026, at 16:18. Note that no news updates will occur from February 16-23 due to Chinese New Year. This provides the latest available pricing data within the timeframe.

title: Steel industry faces challenges amid domestic focus shift
summary: Vietnamese steel companies are shifting focus to the domestic market due to weakening export demand and trade barriers, leading to intense competition and compressed profit margins. Companies like Nam Kim Steel are expanding production capacity with new plants such as the Phú Mỹ Steel plant set to start in Q1 2026, but simultaneous expansions by competitors like VNSteel and Dong A Steel risk oversupply. Analysts highlight challenges in achieving supply-demand balance and rising operating costs impacting profitability.

title: EU steelmakers demand electricity price cut to safeguard the bloc's competitiveness
summary: European steelmakers are urging the EU to reduce electricity prices to around €50/MWh to protect the bloc's steel industry competitiveness. The demand addresses high energy costs impacting production viability amid global challenges.

title: White House denies reports of steel, aluminum tariff rollback
summary: The White House has denied recent reports suggesting a potential rollback of the 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum. This stance maintains current trade protections amid ongoing commodity market discussions.

title: US Steel Faces Weak European Demand Despite Improved Q4 Performance
summary: US Steel anticipates a 9% decline in shipments to 3.25 million net tons for full-year 2025, with capacity utilization dropping to 71% due to weak European demand. Despite improved Q4 performance, ongoing market challenges persist.

title: Ryerson and Olympic Steel Announce Successful Closing of Merger
summary: Ryerson and Olympic Steel have completed their merger, forming the second-largest North American metals service center with expected $120 million in annual synergies by early 2028 through procurement, efficiency, and optimization. The combined entity enhances processing capabilities, geographic expansion, and asset utilization to improve service amid a manufacturing demand upcycle.

title: Alstom deepens Stilfold partnership to advance lightweight steel train components
summary: Alstom and Swedish start-up Stilfold are expanding their collaboration to scale origami-inspired steel technology for lighter, lower-carbon train structures. The process involves bending and folding steel sheets to reduce raw material use, welding, energy demand, and emissions while enhancing structural performance. This aligns with Alstom's innovation efforts in Sweden for more resource-efficient production.

title: Brazil to Host Latin America's First Exclusive Metal Packaging Congress
summary: Brazil will host Latin America's first exclusive metal packaging congress on February 16, 2026. The event focuses on metal packaging innovations, potentially including sustainable steel technologies in the packaging sector. It serves as a platform for industry advancements in the region.

title: Why copper and nickel prices are moving today: key market drivers - Feb 15, 2026
summary: Copper prices rose to $5.80/lb (+0.30%) as of the latest update on Feb 13, 2026, driven by supply tightness, electrification demand, stockpiling, policy risks, supply disruptions, and China demand signals. The market remains sensitive to inventory flows and tariff uncertainties. Nickel prices fell to $16,995/tonne (-1.48%) amid Indonesia supply issues.

title: Why are copper prices rising now: 5 reasons - Copper prices smash records as supply constraints collide with AI-driven demand
summary: Copper prices hit a record high of $14,125 per tonne, settling at $13,935 with intense speculative trading in China amplified by algorithms. Factors include supply constraints, AI and tech demand, US tariff uncertainties, and long-term projections like Goldman Sachs' $15,000/tonne by 2035. The rally reflects energy transition and infrastructure needs despite tepid Chinese industrial demand.

title: Copper Pricing
summary: International Wire reports the copper base price at $8.4000 effective February 16, 2026, for Omega - Camden. Additional indices include COMEX copper monthly average at $5.88100 and LME copper cash settlement at $5.9370 for January 2026. This provides a current pricing snapshot amid ongoing market trends.

title: Copper Prices Drop Before China Break: February 2026 Analysis
summary: Copper prices consolidated around $5.90 per pound in New York markets during February 2026, influenced by market holidays and economic forces ahead of a China break. The analysis highlights volatility tied to these seasonal and economic dynamics.

title: Global copper exchange stocks top 1Mt for first time in two decades
summary: Copper stocks on the world's three biggest metal exchanges exceeded one-million metric tons for the first time in more than two decades. This buildup signals shifting market dynamics potentially impacting prices and supply trends.

title: Global copper exchange stocks top 1Mt for first time in two decades
summary: Copper stocks on the world's three biggest metal exchanges have exceeded one-million metric tons for the first time in more than two decades. This buildup indicates shifting supply dynamics amid recent market pressures. The increase highlights potential easing of immediate tightness despite ongoing production challenges.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.76 USD/Lbs on February 16, 2026, down 0.78% from the previous day. The update includes recent production data from Chile (540.22 thousand tonnes in Dec 2025) and Peru. It notes copper's historical high of 6.58 in January 2026 amid supply and demand trends.

title: Cobre strikes placement for Sierra Atacama acquisition
summary: Cobre (ASX:CBE) is raising $60 million to acquire a 51% stake in the Sierra Atacama Copper Project in Chile. This move supports expansion of copper production capacity in a key mining region. The placement underscores investor interest in new copper developments.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) will source low-carbon copper from Rio Tinto's Nuton technology for U.S. data centers. Nuton uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores, reducing water and emissions intensity while producing pure copper cathode without traditional smelters. The collaboration leverages AWS's cloud analytics to optimize the process, supporting sustainable supply chains for growing tech demands.

title: Rio Tinto to supply AWS with low-carbon copper for US data centers
summary: Rio Tinto has partnered with AWS to supply low-carbon copper produced via its Nuton technology for U.S. data centers. This innovative process extracts copper using microorganisms, bypassing conventional concentrators and smelters to lower emissions and water use. The deal highlights advancements in sustainable copper production amid rising tech sector needs.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Under a two-year agreement, AWS will incorporate the first Nuton-produced copper into U.S. data center components, while providing cloud services to optimize Nuton's operations. Nuton technology enables efficient copper extraction from low-grade ores using bioleaching, cutting the mine-to-market chain and environmental impact. This partnership advances low-carbon materials for digital infrastructure.

title: Why copper and nickel prices are moving today: key market drivers - Feb 15, 2026
summary: Nickel prices are modestly lower at $16,995/tonne as of the February 13 close, amid choppy trading balancing Indonesia-driven supply headlines against oversupply concerns. The market remains sensitive to stainless steel demand and global growth expectations. Copper holds near elevated levels, but nickel faces demand-cycle uncertainty.

title: The Monday Report - 16 February 2026
summary: Spot nickel prices fell 5.10% to $7.63/lb in the latest futures update. The report covers broader metals market movements, including gains in gold and silver amid expectations for UK CPI data. Energy futures show minor declines in crude oil prices.

title: FLASH: ESDM approves nickel ore mining quotas up to 260-270 million tonnes for 2026
summary: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) has approved nickel ore production quotas of 260-270 million tonnes for 2026 under the Nickel Work Plan and Budget (RKAB). Director General Tri Winarno confirmed this target, aligning with prior disclosures from the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association. This quota supports planned mining capacity amid supply management efforts.

title: Nornickel, a Russian nickel producer, will shift some of its nickel production to a copper plant for repairs
summary: Nornickel plans to maintain 2026 nickel production at 193,000-203,000 metric tonnes by shifting some output to a copper facility during a 270-day smelting furnace upgrade at Nadezhda Metallurgical Plant in 2027. This unconventional approach offsets half the plant's capacity loss. The company is preparing production lines for pilot tests this year.

title: Weda Bay Nickel receives sharply reduced 2026 quota
summary: PT Weda Bay Nickel received an initial 2026 RKAB approval for 12 million wet metric tonnes of nickel ore, a 71% cut from late 2025 and below its 42 million tonne target. This aligns with Indonesia's goal to reduce total output to 260-270 million wmt from 379 million in 2025. The company plans to seek revisions, reinforcing market expectations of supply constraints.

title: Why copper and nickel prices are moving today: key market drivers - Feb 15, 2026
summary: Nickel prices reacted to Indonesia ordering Weda Bay, the world's biggest nickel mine complex, to cut its 2026 ore quota. As of February 13 close, nickel stood at $16,995/ton amid supply management headlines. This contributes to broader market movements influenced by Indonesian supply dynamics.

title: Nickel price jumps as Indonesia's top mine cuts output
summary: Quota cuts at PT Weda Bay Nickel, Indonesia's largest producer, are tightening supply, driving a 20% LME nickel rally. Indonesia plans 260-270 million tonnes of nickel ore quotas for 2026, down from 379 million in 2025. Authorities may revise mid-year, amid weaker battery demand but tighter supply outlook.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for EV batteries and green energy. The project features the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste, making it carbon-negative. General Motors has secured an option to purchase all uncommitted nickel and cobalt production for the first 15 years.

title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
summary: Amid surging nickel demand for high-nickel NMC batteries, innovations like LFP, sodium-ion, and solid-state batteries could reduce nickel needs by up to 33% by 2030. Strategies include battery recycling, smaller battery sizes, and diversifying supply chains. Alaska Energy Metals Corporation is advancing sustainable nickel production at its Nikolai project in Alaska to support U.S. energy independence.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported zero lost-time injuries over 17.7 million safe man-hours in its Q4 2025 update, with a low Total Recordable Injury Frequency Rate of 0.68. The company advanced sustainability through a strategic investment in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt, securing nickel cathode offtake, and received awards for ESG leadership. This underscores their commitment to workforce safety and global supply chain standards.

title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
summary: Demand for critical minerals like nickel for EVs is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040 under net-zero scenarios. The mining industry must innovate responsibly through collaboration with governments and tech leaders to balance environmental protection and economic growth. Leaders at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2026 will explore sustainable sourcing strategies.
